Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content:
The latest komodod build is screwing with my VPS control-panel - the damn thing eats up 100% of available memory and then keeps it in cache.
note - komodod only, the assets don't do this.
I've tried 8G/8G (mem/swp) and 12G/8G - same result - all mem used then it stops eating more (doesn't touch the swap).
I know it's not actually using 100% of the mem - just the way it's tying cache is annoying.

Author: zatJUM#9924
Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator https://www.serverhunter.com/

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://www.linuxatemyram.com/ @Bar_F1sh_Rel

Author: MyName#0491
Content:
@Bar_F1sh_Rel if you sort out why, let us know
in everything I've ever done I've never seen KMD komodod go much over 3G much less hit 12

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content: @TonyL yes - I know this behavior in Linux - but this is new for komodo. I know that komodod settles at 3G actually in use but Reserving so much might be a sign of something more - or not.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yeah it could be, I have noticed that LABS komodod does reserve more ram than normal. May have a leak or something.

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content:
It has changed between versions - this is something new.
I have two LABS versions running on standard nodes - older one doesn't put enough pressure on the memory balloon to release more than 4G (of 8G).

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content: I did wonder if this was linked to the changes made to release memory in cached chain memory blocks - as each cache memory block would be released by komodod, but not by Linux.

Content: Deb stretch

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
to make a new CC address for built in:
getnewaddress
validateaddress <newaddr>
change if ( 0 ) -> if ( 1 ) in CCutils.cpp Myprivkey
launch with -pubkey=<pubkey>
do anything to use Myprivkey and this will print the privkey array
add all the #define in CCcustom.cpp and make sure to set the cp-> vars in CCinit
of course add EVAL_newcode in eval.h

Author: blackjok3r#3181
